abouts scanderbeg 〈◊〉 ignorant hereof marched night towards ocriba 12000 men laying ambush three mile break day sent 500 horse two expert captaines commanding enemy came forth fight retire fled traine army comming italy pope pius way great armie come ancona sea side whither christopher duke venice came 10 galley sickning fever died 1464 whereupon armie dispersed exceeding griefe many prince lesse joy turk lauretanus yeare expired victor capella sent generall venetian sea sayling euboea soon took city aulis peloponesus larsum isle himber night surprised athens sethinae carrying away people prisoner rich spoile euboea perswaded shewed patras christian would deliver departing thence landed 4000 foot barbaricus 200 horse ragius come within mile patras many scattering abroad seeking pillage turk garrison setting horse easily overthrew barbaricus slaine ragius taken empailed alive upon sharpe stake scarce 1000 escaping galley victor herewith greatly discomfited yet hope dayes attempted patras againe losing 1000 men rest fleeing fleet departed great dishonour suddenly dying euboea oppressed melancholly venetian much troubled hard proceeding solicited matthias king hungary joyne injury done brother slaine ulricus count cilium uncle ladislaus king bohemia hungaria afterwards cruelly executed bohemia said ladislaus matthias kept prison young ladislaus taken away untimely death unkindnesse venetian refused often aide hungarian king like case saying received harme turk c undertook protection aforesaid territory passing danubius belgrade next spring puissant armie razed turk therein doth much otherwise report selimus saith 300000 coming euphrates bridge broken amurat enemy encamped farther side new supply hysmael persian 90000 horse foot two serviceable horse apiece neither could selimus way learn whether hysmael feared raising greater force wherefore repairing bridge sent casan sinan bassas encamped thought convenient next morning amurat two houres sunrising suddenly assailed casan trench discomfiting taking tent whereupon terror came sinan men swam great danger rest selimus troubled hereat placed artillery along hither bank euphrates hide ranged unshipping warlike necessary storm wind rain began 6 afternoon holding night rage whole army land wondrously troubled great part fleet driven aground perished 3 italian company lay without trench resident hadrianople february 16th came honourable embassage 〈◊〉 persian king selimus entreat rather conclude peace agreed upon controversy afterwards fell open warres greatest pomp entertained turk doubting relief sinan without cause suspected love yield reasonable composition garrison janizaries would case give consent whereupon prince houres furious battery took city castle assault putting
